chinese: take a long walk in the mountains or countryside （在···）徒步旅行，远足
examples: e.g. His dream is to [[hike]] the world's highest mountain.；e.g. We went for a [[hike]] through the woods on Sunday.

chinese: [C] a long walk in the mountains or countryside （在山区或乡间的）徒步旅行，远足
examples: e.g. His dream is to [[hike]] the world's highest mountain.；e.g. We went for a [[hike]] through the woods on Sunday.

chinese: [U] 植物学
[U] the state of being kept safe, or the action of keeping sth. safe 安全保管 ; 妥善保管
examples: e.g. My passport was in the inner pocket of my bag, for [[safekeeping]].

chinese: [C] a person who is very interested in a particular hobby 爱好者
examples: e.g. The computer [[hobbyists]] are going to love this project.

chinese: [C] 松针；松叶
make cloth, a carpet, a basket, etc. by crossing threads or thin pieces under and over each other by hand or on a loom 编；织
examples: e.g. This type of wool is [[woven]] into fabric which will make jackets.

chinese: if two things merge, or if one thing merges into another, you cannot clearly see them, hear them, etc. as separate things 相融；融入；渐渐消失在另一物中
examples: e.g. The hills [[merged]] into the dark sky behind them.；e.g. The banks are set to [[merge]] next year.

chinese: combine, or join things together to form one thing 合并；融合
examples: e.g. The hills [[merged]] into the dark sky behind them.；e.g. The banks are set to [[merge]] next year.

chinese: not able to be identified as different or distinct 难以分辨的；难以区分的
examples: e.g. The male of the species is almost [[indistinguishable]] from the female.

chinese: [U] the rate at which goods are produced, and the amount produced, esp. in relation to the work, time, and money needed to produce them 生产率；生产效率；生产量；生产力
examples: e.g. Studies show that if a working environment is pleasant, [[productivity]] increases.

chinese: a new business activity that involves taking risks 风险项目；风险投资；冒险事业
examples: e.g. The company's latest [[venture]] in the tech industry proved to be a success.

chinese: 1) the state of being weak or uncertain, and likely to become worse under pressure （形式）脆弱，不稳定
examples: e.g. The collapse of the bank is a reminder of the [[fragility]] of the world’s banking system.；e.g. A deficiency of copper (缺铜) can cause increased bone [[fragility]].

chinese: 2) the state of being easily broken or damaged 脆弱；易碎；易损坏
examples: e.g. The collapse of the bank is a reminder of the [[fragility]] of the world’s banking system.；e.g. A deficiency of copper (缺铜) can cause increased bone [[fragility]].

chinese: 1) easy to obtain or use 易得到的；易使用的
examples: e.g. I had to keep the video camera readily [[accessible]] in case I saw something that needed to be filmed.；e.g. The remote desert area is only [[accessible]] by helicopter (直升机).

chinese: 2) easy to reach or get into 易到达的；易进入的
examples: e.g. I had to keep the video camera readily [[accessible]] in case I saw something that needed to be filmed.；e.g. The remote desert area is only [[accessible]] by helicopter (直升机).

chinese: [C] a big company, or a group of companies acting together as a single organization 大型公司；企业集团
examples: e.g. She didn't want to work for a big [[corporation]] where everything was so impersonal.

chinese: 1) available to be used 可以使用的
examples: e.g. The nation's [[disposable]] earnings amounted to 586 billion dollars.；e.g. She joined Kiley at the counter, holding a [[disposable]] cup with coffee in it.

chinese: 2) intended to be used once or for a short time and then thrown away 一次性的；用完即弃的
examples: e.g. The nation's [[disposable]] earnings amounted to 586 billion dollars.；e.g. She joined Kiley at the counter, holding a [[disposable]] cup with coffee in it.

chinese: [C] 游乐场
1) start to exist; appear or become known 兴起；开始被人所知
examples: e.g. The state [[emerges]] as a leader in the field of next-generation energy.；e.g. The doors opened and people began to [[emerge]] into the street.

chinese: 2) appear or come out from somewhere 出现；浮现
examples: e.g. The state [[emerges]] as a leader in the field of next-generation energy.；e.g. The doors opened and people began to [[emerge]] into the street.

chinese: [C] a special advantage that is given only to one person or group of people 特权；特殊待遇
examples: e.g. Senior management enjoys certain [[privileges]], such as company cars and private health care.

chinese: 1) (the ~) [pl.] people who have a lot of money, possessions, etc. 有钱人；富人
examples: e.g. The best education should not be available only to the [[wealthy]].；e.g. He left as a poor, working class boy and returned as an extremely [[wealthy]] man.

chinese: 2) having a lot of money, possessions, etc. 富有的；有钱的
examples: e.g. The best education should not be available only to the [[wealthy]].；e.g. He left as a poor, working class boy and returned as an extremely [[wealthy]] man.

chinese: (of a device or process) working by itself with little or no direct human control （装置或流程）自动的
examples: e.g. The door we escaped through had an [[automatic]] lock but we didn't know that.

chinese: the state of being successful, esp. financially 兴隆；发达；繁荣；昌盛
examples: e.g. A country's future [[prosperity]] depends, to an extent, upon the quality of education of its people.

chinese: [U] a political situation in which people protest or behave violently 动荡；动乱；骚动
examples: e.g. Due to the economic downturn, there's growing social [[unrest]] in the country.

chinese: [C, U] a situation in which there is not enough of sth. that people need 短缺；不足；缺乏
examples: e.g. The long hot summer has led to serious water [[shortages]].

chinese: [C, U] a difficult time when there is less trade, business activity, etc. in a country than usual （经济）衰退，萧条
examples: e.g. We should concentrate on sharply reducing interest rates to pull the economy out of [[recession]].

chinese: unhappy or not satisfied with the situation you are in 不满的；不满足的；不愉快的
examples: e.g. He felt [[discontented]] with the way his life had turned out.

chinese: giving pleasure 令人愉快的；令人快乐的
examples: e.g. We spent an [[enjoyable]] evening talking about old times.

chinese: certain to happen and impossible to avoid 必然发生的；不可避免的
examples: e.g. It was an [[inevitable]] consequence of the decision.

chinese: consider that two things are similar or connected 使等同；同等看待
examples: e.g. Some people [[equate]] fame with success, but I don't think so.

chinese: (only before noun) having two of sth. or two parts 双的；双重的；两部分的
examples: e.g. The piece of furniture serves a [[dual]] purpose as a cupboard and as a table.

chinese: [U] (fml.) the state of having two of sth. or two parts 双重性
examples: e.g. His poems reveal the [[duality]] of his nature, the joy and hope, the fear and despair.

chinese: having a strong belief that everything can be perfect, often in a way that does not seem to be realistic or practical 乌托邦的；空想完美主义的
examples: e.g. He was pursuing a [[utopian]] dream of world prosperity.

chinese: [C] (mainly AmE, infml.) a piece of work or a job that you get paid for doing in addition to doing your main job 副业
examples: e.g. Even if you love your job and find your work fulfilling, you can still benefit from a [[side hustle]].

chinese: (fml.) concerning sb. / sth.; about sb. / sth. 关于
examples: e.g. [[Regarding]] your recent inquiry, I have sent you a copy of our new brochure.

chinese: 1) the point at which one feeling, idea, quality, etc. stops and another starts （不同情感、思想、品质等之间的）分野，分界线
examples: e.g. The [[boundaries]] between history and storytelling are always being blurred.；e.g. The Mississippi River forms a natural [[boundary]] between Iowa and Illinois.

chinese: 2) the real or imaginary line that marks the edge of a state, country, etc., or the edge of an area of land that belongs to sb. 分界线；边界
examples: e.g. The [[boundaries]] between history and storytelling are always being blurred.；e.g. The Mississippi River forms a natural [[boundary]] between Iowa and Illinois.

chinese: 1) relating to the practice of emptying your mind of thoughts and feelings, in order to relax completely or for religious reasons 冥想的；默想的
examples: e.g. She closed her eyes and went into a [[meditative]] state.；e.g. When he entered the room, she was in a [[meditative]] mood.

chinese: 2) thinking deeply and seriously about sth.; involving deep thought 深思的；沉思的；思考的
examples: e.g. She closed her eyes and went into a [[meditative]] state.；e.g. When he entered the room, she was in a [[meditative]] mood.

chinese: [C] (BrE paycheque) (esp. AmE) the amount of wages sb. earns 薪金；工资
examples: e.g. The new bill could mean a larger [[paycheck]] for state employees.

chinese: spoil or destroy sth. completely 毁坏；毁掉；糟蹋
examples: e.g. Huge modern hotels have [[ruined]] this once undisturbed coastline.

chinese: [U] the quality or state of being pure 纯；纯洁；洁净；纯正；纯粹
examples: e.g. The color white is the color of [[purity]] and that is why women typically wear white when they get married.

chinese: improve sth. 改善；改进
examples: e.g. The measures taken should considerably [[enhance]] the residents' quality of life.

chinese: essentially or innately 生性
examples: e.g. She was [[by nature]] a very sensitive person.

english: have a hard time doing sth.
chinese: be difficult for sb. to do sth. 做某事很难
examples: e.g. I [[had a hard time]] persuading him to accept the offer.

chinese: cause sb. to do sth. 导致某人做某事
examples: e.g. What [[led]] him to reconsider his position?

chinese: depend on sb. to provide help, advice, etc. 指望；依靠
examples: e.g. They're [[looking to]] the new manager to make the company profitable.
